entry.title: Catherine, Princess of Wales (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Catherine, Princess of Wales (pictured), is a keen amateur photographer and the patron of the Royal Photographic Society, and has taken many official photographs of her children?

entry.title: a Connecticut radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Connecticut radio station left the FM band for good after it was out of service for a week and only one person wrote a letter to complain?

entry.title: Hermann Alfred Tanner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Swiss mountaineer Hermann Alfred Tanner invented a compass to navigate colour harmony?

entry.title: January 1982 California floods (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the January 1982 California floods, more than 18,000 landslides swept through the San Francisco Bay Area with little warning?

entry.title: Kathanar – The Wild Sorcerer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kathanar – The Wild Sorcerer is being shot on a custom-built studio spanning 45,000 square feet, utilizing the virtual production technology?

entry.title: The Origins of Early Christian Literature (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in her 2021 book The Origins of Early Christian Literature, Robyn Faith Walsh found that German Romanticists were in part responsible for modern scholarly assumptions about the gospels?

entry.title: Ryland Davies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a 1974 recording of Mozart's Così fan tutte with Ryland Davies as Ferrando was used in a 1995 film by the Salzburg Marionette Theatre?

entry.title: Haewoojae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that sculptures of defecating people are displayed in the park surrounding Haewoojae?
